images.title: THE FOREST
images.quote: Midway upon the journey of our life / I found myself within a forest dark, / For the straightforward pathway had been lost

images.title: THE PANTHER
images.quote: And lo! almost where the ascent began, / A panther light and swift exceedingly, / Which with a spotted skin was covered o'er!

images.title: THE LION
images.quote: He seemed as if against me he were coming / With head uplifted, and with ravenous hunger

images.title: THE SHE-WOLF
images.quote: "Behold the beast, for which I have turned back; / Do thou protect me from her, famous Sage"

images.title: VIRGIL AND DANTE
images.quote: Then he moved on, and I behind him followed

images.title: VIRGIL AND DANTE
images.quote: Day was departing

images.title: BEATRICE AND VIRGIL
images.quote: "Beatrice am I, who do bid thee go"

images.title: THE GATE OF HELL
images.quote: "All hope abandon, ye who enter in!"

images.title: CHARON AND THE RIVER ACHERON
images.quote: And lo! towards us coming in a boat / An old man, hoary with the hair of eld, / Crying: "Woe unto you, ye souls depraved!"

images.title: THE EMBARKATION OF THE SOULS
images.quote: Charon the demon, with the eyes of glede, / Beckoning to them, collects them all together, / Beats with his oar whoever lags behind

images.title: LIMBO—THE INNOCENT SOULS
images.quote: "Lost are we, and are only so far punished, / That without hope we live on in desire"

images.title: LIMBO—POETS AND HEROES
images.quote: Thus I beheld assemble the fair school / Of that lord of the song pre-eminent, / Who o'er the others like an eagle soars

images.title: MINOS
images.quote: There standeth Minos horribly, and snarls; / Examines the transgressions at the entrance; / Judges, and sends according as he girds him

images.title: THE LUSTFUL
images.quote: The infernal hurricane that never rests / Hurtles the spirits onward in its rapine

images.title: PAOLO AND FRANCESCA
images.quote: "O Poet, willingly / Speak would I to those two, who go together, / And seem upon the wind to be so light"

images.title: PAOLO AND FRANCESCA
images.quote: "Love has conducted us unto one death; / Caïna waiteth him who quenched our life!"

images.title: PAOLO AND FRANCESCA
images.quote: "That day no farther did we read therein"

images.title: PAOLO AND FRANCESCA
images.quote: I swooned away as if I had been dying, / And fell, even as a dead body falls

images.title: CERBERUS
images.quote: And my Conductor, with his spans extended, / Took of the earth, and with his fists well filled, / He threw it into those rapacious gullets

images.title: THE GLUTTONS—CIACCO
images.quote: "For the pernicious sin of gluttony / I, as thou seest, am battered by this rain"

images.title: PLUTO AND VIRGIL
images.quote: "Be silent thou accursed wolf; / Consume within thyself with thine own rage"

images.title: THE AVARICIOUS AND PRODIGAL
images.quote: "For all the gold that is beneath the moon, / Or ever has been, of these weary souls / Could never make a single one repose"

images.title: THE STYX—THE IRASCIBLE
images.quote: "Son, thou now beholdest / The souls of those whom anger overcame"

images.title: THE STYX—PHLEGYAS
images.quote: The antique prow goes on its way, dividing / More of the water than't is wont with others

images.title: THE STYX—PHILIPPO ARGENTI
images.quote: Then stretched he both his hands unto the boat; / Whereat my wary Master thrust him back

images.title: THE PORTALS OF DIS
images.quote: I could not hear what he proposed to them; / But with them there he did not linger long, / Ere each within in rivalry ran back

images.title: THE ERINNYS
images.quote: "This is Megaera, on the left-hand side; / She who is weeping on the right, Alecto; / Tisiphone is between"

images.title: THE ANGEL
images.quote: He reached the gate, and with a little rod / He opened it, for there was no resistance

images.title: BURNING GRAVES—THE HERESIARCHS
images.quote: "My Master, what are all those people / Who, having sepulture within those tombs, / Make themselves audible by doleful sighs?"

images.title: FARINATA
images.quote: As soon as I was at the foot of his tomb, / Somewhat he eyed me, and, as if disdainful, / Then asked of me, "Who were thine ancestors?"

images.title: THE TOMB OF ANASTASIUS
images.quote: We drew ourselves aside behind the cover / Of a great tomb, whereon I saw a writing, / Which said: "Pope Anastasius I hold"

images.title: THE MINOTAUR
images.quote: And on the border of the broken chasm / The infamy of Crete was stretched along, / Who was conceived in the fictitious cow

images.title: THE CENTAURS—NESSUS
images.quote: Beholding us descend, each one stood still, / And from the squadron three detached themselves, / With bows and arrows in advance selected

images.title: CHIRON
images.quote: Chiron an arrow took, and with the notch / Backward upon his jaws he put his beard

images.title: THE HARPIES' WOOD
images.quote: They make laments upon the wondrous trees

images.title: THE SUICIDES
images.quote: Then stretched I forth my hand a little forward, / And plucked a branchlet off from a great thorn; / And the trunk cried, "Why dost thou mangle me?"

images.title: THE SUICIDES
images.quote: And two behold! upon our left-hand side, / Naked and scratched, fleeing so furiously, / That of the forest every fan they broke

images.title: THE BLASPHEMERS—CAPANEUS
images.quote: O'er all the sand-waste, with a gradual fall, / Raining down dilated flakes of fire

images.title: BRUNETTO LATINI
images.quote: "Are you here, Ser Brunetto?"

images.title: GERYON—SYMBOL OF DECEIT
images.quote: And that uncleanly image of deceit / Came up and thrust ashore its head and bust

images.title: THE DESCENT ON THE MONSTER
images.quote: Onward he goeth, swimming slowly, slowly; / Wheels and descends

images.title: DEVILS AND SEDUCERS
images.quote: Ah me! how they did make them lift their legs / At the first blows!

images.title: PARAMOURS AND FLATTERERS
images.quote: I saw a people smothered in a filth / That out of human privies seemed to flow

images.title: THAÏS
images.quote: "Thaïs the harlot is it, who replied / Unto her paramour, when he said, 'Have I / Great gratitude from thee?'—'Nay, marvellous'"

images.title: THE SIMONISTS
images.quote: "O doleful soul, implanted like a stake," / To say began I, "if thou canst, speak out"

images.title: DEVILS AND BARRATORS
images.quote: They seized him then with more than a hundred rakes

images.title: DEVILS AND VIRGIL
images.quote: But he cried out: "Be none of you malignant!"

images.title: BARRATORS—GIAMPOLO
images.quote: Therefore he moved, and cried: "Thou art o'ertaken"

images.title: ALICHINO AND CALCABRINA
images.quote: But sooth the other was a doughty sparhawk / To clapperclaw him well; and both of them / Fell in the middle of the boiling pond

images.title: TUMULT AND ESCAPE
images.quote: Hardly the bed of the ravine below / His feet had reached, ere they had reached the hill / Right over us

images.title: THE HYPOCRITES
images.quote: They had on mantles with the hoods low down / Before their eyes

images.title: THE HYPOCRITES—CRUCIFIED PHARISEE
images.quote: "This transfixed one, whom thou seest, / Counselled the Pharisees that it was meet / To put one man to torture for the people"

images.title: THIEVES
images.quote: Among this cruel and most dismal throng / People were running naked and affrighted

images.title: TRANSFORMATION INTO SNAKES
images.quote: "O me, Agnello, how thou changest! / Behold, thou now art neither two nor one"

images.title: EVIL COUNSELLORS
images.quote: "Within the fires the spirits are; / Each swathes himself with that wherewith he burns"

images.title: SCHISMATICS—MAHOMET
images.quote: He looked at me, and opened with his hands / His bosom, saying: "See now how I rend me"

images.title: SOWER OF DISCORD
images.quote: "Call to remembrance Pier da Medicina"

images.title: BERTRAM DE BORN
images.quote: By the hair it held the head dissevered, / Hung from the hand in fashion of a lantern, / And that upon us gazed and said: "O me!"

images.title: GERI DEL BELLO
images.quote: But said Virgilius: "What dost thou still gaze at? / Why is thy sight still riveted down there / Among the mournful, mutilated shades?"

images.title: FORGERS
images.quote: Such a stench came from it / As from putrescent limbs is wont to issue

images.title: FORGERS
images.quote: Every one was plying fast the bite / Of nails upon himself, for the great rage / Of itching which no other succour had

images.title: FORGERS
images.quote: "That mad sprite is Gianni Schicchi, / And raving goes thus harrying other people"

images.title: MYRRHA
images.quote: "That is the ancient ghost / Of the nefarious Myrrha, who became / Beyond all rightful love her father's lover"

images.title: THE GIANTS—NIMROD
images.quote: "Soul idiotic, / Keep to thy horn, and vent thyself with that, / When wrath or other passion touches thee"

images.title: EPHIALTES
images.quote: "This proud one wished to make experiment / Of his own power against the Supreme Jove"

images.title: ANTAEUS—DESCENT TO THE LAST CIRCLE
images.quote: But lightly in the abyss, which swallows up / Judas with Lucifer, he put us down

images.title: COCYTUS—TRAITORS
images.quote: "Look how thou steppest! / Take heed thou do not trample with thy feet / The heads of the tired, miserable brothers!"

images.title: TRAITORS—BOCCA DEGLI ABATI
images.quote: Then by the scalp behind I seized upon him, / And said: "It must needs be thou name thyself, / Or not a hair remain upon thee here"

images.title: UGOLINO AND ARCHBISHOP RUGGIERI
images.quote: The uppermost on the other set his teeth, / There where the brain is to the nape united

images.title: UGOLINO
images.quote: "I calmed me then, not to make them more sad"

images.title: UGOLINO AND GADDO
images.quote: "Gaddo / Threw himself down outstretched before my feet, / Saying, 'My father, why dost thou not help me?'"

images.title: UGOLINO
images.quote: "Then hunger did what sorrow could not do"

images.title: THE JUDECCA—LUCIFER
images.quote: "Behold Dis, and behold the place / Where thou with fortitude must arm thyself"

images.title: THE WAY TO THE UPPER WORLD
images.quote: The Guide and I into that hidden road / Now entered, to return to the bright world

images.title: THE POETS EMERGE FROM HELL
images.quote: Thence we came forth to rebehold the stars

images.title: VENUS
images.quote: The beauteous planet, that to love incites, / Was making all the orient to laugh, / Veiling the Fishes that were in her escort

images.title: CATO OF UTICA
images.quote: I saw beside me an old man alone, / Worthy of so much reverence in his look, / That more owes not to father any son

images.title: THE VESSEL
images.quote: But when he clearly recognized the pilot, / He cried: "Make haste, make haste to bow the knee! / Behold the Angel of God!"

images.title: THE CELESTIAL PILOT
images.quote: Beatitude seemed written in his face

images.title: THE MOUNTAIN'S FOOT
images.quote: On the left hand appeared to me a throng / Of souls, that moved their feet in our direction, / And did not seem to move

images.title: THE ASCENT
images.quote: We mounted upward through the rifted rock, / And on each side the border pressed upon us

images.title: THE LATE REPENTERS
images.quote: There were persons there / Who in the shadow stood behind the rock, / As one through indolence is wont to stand

images.title: THE LATE REPENTERS
images.quote: Meanwhile along the mountain-side across / Came people in advance of us a little, / Singing the Miserere verse by verse

images.title: BUONCONTE DA MONTEFELTRO
images.quote: "God's Angel took me up, and he of hell / Shouted: 'O thou from heaven, why dost thou rob me?'"

images.title: PIA
images.quote: "Do thou remember me who am the Pia; / Siena made me, unmade me Maremma"

images.title: SORDELLO AND VIRGIL
images.quote: So he appeared; and then bowed down his brow, / And with humility returned towards him, / And, where inferiors embrace, embraced him

images.title: THE DELL
images.quote: "Salve Regina," on the green and flowers / There seated, singing, spirits I beheld

images.title: THE SERPENT
images.quote: Hearing the air cleft by their verdant wings, / The serpent fled, and round the Angels wheeled

images.title: TWILIGHT
images.quote: The concubine of old Tithonus now / Gleamed white upon the eastern balcony

images.title: THE EAGLE
images.quote: Terrible as the lightning he descended, / And snatched me upward even to the fire

images.title: THE PORTALS OF PURGATORY
images.quote: I saw him seated on the highest stair, / Such in the face that I endured it not. / And in his hand he held a naked sword

images.title: THE SCULPTURES
images.quote: The wretched woman in the midst of these / Seemed to be saying: "Give me vengeance, Lord, / For my dead son"

images.title: THE PRIDEFUL—ODERISI
images.quote: Abreast, like oxen going in a yoke, / I with that heavy-laden soul went on

images.title: ARACHNE
images.quote: O mad Arachne! so I thee beheld / E'en then half spider

images.title: THE ENVIOUS
images.quote: Covered with sackcloth vile they seemed to me, / And one sustained the other with his shoulder, / And all of them were by the bank sustained

images.title: SAPIA
images.quote: "Sienese was I," it replied, "and with / The others here recleanse my guilty life"

images.title: THE STONING OF STEPHEN
images.quote: Then saw I people hot in fire of wrath, / With stones a young man slaying, clamorously / Still crying to each other, "Kill him! kill him!"

images.title: MARCO THE LOMBARD
images.quote: "Now who art thou, that cleavest through our smoke, / And art discoursing of us even as though / Thou didst by calends still divide the time?"

images.title: MARCO THE LOMBARD
images.quote: "Thee will I follow far as is allowed me," / He answered; "and if smoke prevent our seeing, / Hearing shall keep us joined instead thereof"

images.title: THE SLOTHFUL
images.quote: But taken from me was this drowsiness / Suddenly by a people, that behind / Our backs already had come round to us

images.title: ASCENT TO THE FIFTH CIRCLE
images.quote: "What aileth thee, that aye to earth thou gazest?" / To me my Guide began to say, we both / Somewhat beyond the Angel having mounted

images.title: THE AVARICIOUS—ADRIAN V
images.quote: "What cause," he said, "has downward bent thee thus?" / And I to him: "For your own dignity, / Standing, my conscience stung me with remorse"

images.title: THE AVARICIOUS
images.quote: Onward we went with footsteps slow and scarce, / And I attentive to the shades I heard / Piteously weeping and bemoaning them

images.title: THE GLUTTONS—FORESE
images.quote: "Ah, do not look at this dry leprosy," / Entreated he, "which doth my skin discolor, / Nor at default of flesh that I may have"

images.title: THE GLUTTONS
images.quote: And shadows, that appeared things doubly dead, / From out the sepulchres of their eyes betrayed / Wonder at me, aware that I was living

images.title: THE TREE
images.quote: People I saw beneath it lift their hands, / And cry I know not what towards the leaves

images.title: THE SEVENTH CIRCLE
images.quote: There the embankment shoots forth flames of fire, / And upward doth the cornice breathe a blast / That drives them back, and from itself sequesters

images.title: THE SEVENTH CIRCLE
images.quote: "Summae Deus clementiae," in the bosom / Of the great burning chanted then I heard, / Which made me no less eager to turn round

images.title: THE SEVENTH CIRCLE—THE LUSTFUL
images.quote: And spirits saw I walking through the flame; / Wherefore I looked, to my own steps and theirs / Apportioning my sight from time to time

images.title: LEAH
images.quote: Youthful and beautiful in dreams methought / I saw a lady walking in a meadow, / Gathering flowers

images.title: TERRESTRIAL PARADISE
images.quote: Already my slow steps had carried me / Into the ancient wood so far, that I / Could not perceive where I had entered it

images.title: APOCALYPTIC PROCESSION
images.quote: The four and twenty Elders, two by two, / Came on incoronate with flower-de-luce

images.title: CHARITY, HOPE AND FAITH
images.quote: One so very red / That in the fire she hardly had been noted. / The second was as if her flesh and bones / Had all been fashioned out of emerald; / The third appeared as snow but newly fallen

images.title: BEATRICE
images.quote: Appeared a lady under a green mantle, / Vested in color of the living flame

images.title: SUBMERSION IN LETHE
images.quote: The beautiful lady opened wide her arms, / Embraced my head, and plunged me underneath, / Where I was forced to swallow the water

images.title: THE WHORE AND THE GIANT
images.quote: Upright beside her I beheld a giant; / And ever and anon they kissed each other

images.title: THE EUNOË
images.quote: If, Reader, I possessed a longer space / For writing it, I yet would sing in part / Of the sweet draught that ne'er would satiate me

images.title: THE MOON
images.quote: Saw I many faces prompt to speak

images.title: MERCURY
images.quote: So I beheld more than a thousand splendors / Drawing towards us

images.title: VENUS—CHARLES MARTEL
images.quote: "That left-hand margin, which did bathe itself / In Rhone, when it is mingled with the Sorgue, / Me for its lord awaited in due time"

images.title: THE SUN—GLORIFIED SOULS
images.quote: In such wise of those sempiternal roses / The garlands twain encompassed us about, / And thus the outer to the inner answered

images.title: MARS
images.quote: Well was I ware that I was more uplifted / By the enkindled smiling of the star, / That seemed to me more ruddy than its wont

images.title: THE CROSS
images.quote: Here doth my memory overcome my genius; / For on that cross as levin gleamed forth Christ, / So that I cannot find ensample worthy

images.title: CACCIAGUIDA
images.quote: "You are my ancestor, / You give to me all hardihood to speak, / You lift me so that I am more than I"

images.title: JUPITER
images.quote: The holy creatures / Sang flying to and fro

images.title: JUPITER
images.quote: O soldiery of heaven, whom I contemplate, / Implore for those who are upon the earth / All gone astray after the bad example!

images.title: THE EAGLE
images.quote: Appeared before me with its wings outspread / The beautiful image that in sweet fruition / Made jubilant the interwoven souls

images.title: THE EAGLE
images.quote: Those living luminaries all, / By far more luminous, did songs begin / Lapsing and falling from my memory

images.title: BEATRICE
images.quote: Already on my Lady's face mine eyes / Again were fastened

images.title: SATURN
images.quote: A stairway I beheld to such height / Uplifted, that mine eye pursued it not

images.title: THE HEAVEN OF THE FIXED STARS
images.quote: "Begin then, and declare to what thy soul / Is aimed, and count it for a certainty, / Sight is in thee bewildered and not dead"

images.title: THE HEAVEN OF THE FIXED STARS
images.quote: "Glory be to the Father, to the Son, / And Holy Ghost!" all Paradise began, / So that the melody inebriate made me

images.title: CRYSTALLINE HEAVEN
images.quote: Not otherwise does iron scintillate / When molten, than those circles scintillated

images.title: THE EMPYREAN
images.quote: In fashion then as of a snow-white rose / Displayed itself to me the saintly host

inferno-1.title: THE FOREST
inferno-1.quote: Midway upon the journey of our life / I found myself within a forest dark, / For the straightforward pathway had been lost

inferno-1.title: THE PANTHER
inferno-1.quote: And lo! almost where the ascent began, / A panther light and swift exceedingly, / Which with a spotted skin was covered o'er!

inferno-1.title: THE LION
inferno-1.quote: He seemed as if against me he were coming / With head uplifted, and with ravenous hunger

inferno-1.title: THE SHE-WOLF
inferno-1.quote: "Behold the beast, for which I have turned back; / Do thou protect me from her, famous Sage"

inferno-1.title: VIRGIL AND DANTE
inferno-1.quote: Then he moved on, and I behind him followed

inferno-2.title: BEATRICE AND VIRGIL
inferno-2.quote: "Beatrice am I, who do bid thee go"

inferno-3.title: THE GATE OF HELL
inferno-3.quote: "All hope abandon, ye who enter in!"

inferno-3.title: CHARON AND THE RIVER ACHERON
inferno-3.quote: And lo! towards us coming in a boat / An old man, hoary with the hair of eld, / Crying: "Woe unto you, ye souls depraved!"

inferno-3.title: THE EMBARKATION OF THE SOULS
inferno-3.quote: Charon the demon, with the eyes of glede, / Beckoning to them, collects them all together, / Beats with his oar whoever lags behind

inferno-4.title: LIMBO—THE INNOCENT SOULS
inferno-4.quote: "Lost are we, and are only so far punished, / That without hope we live on in desire"

inferno-4.title: LIMBO—POETS AND HEROES
inferno-4.quote: Thus I beheld assemble the fair school / Of that lord of the song pre-eminent, / Who o'er the others like an eagle soars

inferno-5.title: MINOS
inferno-5.quote: There standeth Minos horribly, and snarls; / Examines the transgressions at the entrance; / Judges, and sends according as he girds him

inferno-5.title: THE LUSTFUL
inferno-5.quote: The infernal hurricane that never rests / Hurtles the spirits onward in its rapine

inferno-5.title: PAOLO AND FRANCESCA
inferno-5.quote: "O Poet, willingly / Speak would I to those two, who go together, / And seem upon the wind to be so light"

inferno-5.title: PAOLO AND FRANCESCA
inferno-5.quote: "Love has conducted us unto one death; / Caïna waiteth him who quenched our life!"

inferno-5.title: PAOLO AND FRANCESCA
inferno-5.quote: "That day no farther did we read therein"

inferno-5.title: PAOLO AND FRANCESCA
inferno-5.quote: I swooned away as if I had been dying, / And fell, even as a dead body falls

inferno-6.title: CERBERUS
inferno-6.quote: And my Conductor, with his spans extended, / Took of the earth, and with his fists well filled, / He threw it into those rapacious gullets

inferno-6.title: THE GLUTTONS—CIACCO
inferno-6.quote: "For the pernicious sin of gluttony / I, as thou seest, am battered by this rain"

inferno-7.title: PLUTO AND VIRGIL
inferno-7.quote: "Be silent thou accursed wolf; / Consume within thyself with thine own rage"

inferno-7.title: THE AVARICIOUS AND PRODIGAL
inferno-7.quote: "For all the gold that is beneath the moon, / Or ever has been, of these weary souls / Could never make a single one repose"

inferno-7.title: THE STYX—THE IRASCIBLE
inferno-7.quote: "Son, thou now beholdest / The souls of those whom anger overcame"

inferno-8.title: THE STYX—PHLEGYAS
inferno-8.quote: The antique prow goes on its way, dividing / More of the water than't is wont with others

inferno-8.title: THE STYX—PHILIPPO ARGENTI
inferno-8.quote: Then stretched he both his hands unto the boat; / Whereat my wary Master thrust him back

inferno-8.title: THE PORTALS OF DIS
inferno-8.quote: I could not hear what he proposed to them; / But with them there he did not linger long, / Ere each within in rivalry ran back

inferno-9.title: THE ERINNYS
inferno-9.quote: "This is Megaera, on the left-hand side; / She who is weeping on the right, Alecto; / Tisiphone is between"

inferno-9.title: THE ANGEL
inferno-9.quote: He reached the gate, and with a little rod / He opened it, for there was no resistance

inferno-9.title: BURNING GRAVES—THE HERESIARCHS
inferno-9.quote: "My Master, what are all those people / Who, having sepulture within those tombs, / Make themselves audible by doleful sighs?"

inferno-10.title: FARINATA
inferno-10.quote: As soon as I was at the foot of his tomb, / Somewhat he eyed me, and, as if disdainful, / Then asked of me, "Who were thine ancestors?"

inferno-11.title: THE TOMB OF ANASTASIUS
inferno-11.quote: We drew ourselves aside behind the cover / Of a great tomb, whereon I saw a writing, / Which said: "Pope Anastasius I hold"

inferno-12.title: THE MINOTAUR
inferno-12.quote: And on the border of the broken chasm / The infamy of Crete was stretched along, / Who was conceived in the fictitious cow

inferno-12.title: THE CENTAURS—NESSUS
inferno-12.quote: Beholding us descend, each one stood still, / And from the squadron three detached themselves, / With bows and arrows in advance selected

inferno-12.title: CHIRON
inferno-12.quote: Chiron an arrow took, and with the notch / Backward upon his jaws he put his beard

inferno-13.title: THE HARPIES' WOOD
inferno-13.quote: They make laments upon the wondrous trees

inferno-13.title: THE SUICIDES
inferno-13.quote: Then stretched I forth my hand a little forward, / And plucked a branchlet off from a great thorn; / And the trunk cried, "Why dost thou mangle me?"

inferno-13.title: THE SUICIDES
inferno-13.quote: And two behold! upon our left-hand side, / Naked and scratched, fleeing so furiously, / That of the forest every fan they broke

inferno-14.title: THE BLASPHEMERS—CAPANEUS
inferno-14.quote: O'er all the sand-waste, with a gradual fall, / Raining down dilated flakes of fire

inferno-17.title: GERYON—SYMBOL OF DECEIT
inferno-17.quote: And that uncleanly image of deceit / Came up and thrust ashore its head and bust

inferno-17.title: THE DESCENT ON THE MONSTER
inferno-17.quote: Onward he goeth, swimming slowly, slowly; / Wheels and descends

inferno-18.title: DEVILS AND SEDUCERS
inferno-18.quote: Ah me! how they did make them lift their legs / At the first blows!

inferno-18.title: PARAMOURS AND FLATTERERS
inferno-18.quote: I saw a people smothered in a filth / That out of human privies seemed to flow

inferno-18.title: THAÏS
inferno-18.quote: "Thaïs the harlot is it, who replied / Unto her paramour, when he said, 'Have I / Great gratitude from thee?'—'Nay, marvellous'"

inferno-19.title: THE SIMONISTS
inferno-19.quote: "O doleful soul, implanted like a stake," / To say began I, "if thou canst, speak out"

inferno-21.title: DEVILS AND BARRATORS
inferno-21.quote: They seized him then with more than a hundred rakes

inferno-21.title: DEVILS AND VIRGIL
inferno-21.quote: But he cried out: "Be none of you malignant!"

inferno-22.title: BARRATORS—GIAMPOLO
inferno-22.quote: Therefore he moved, and cried: "Thou art o'ertaken"

inferno-22.title: ALICHINO AND CALCABRINA
inferno-22.quote: But sooth the other was a doughty sparhawk / To clapperclaw him well; and both of them / Fell in the middle of the boiling pond

inferno-23.title: TUMULT AND ESCAPE
inferno-23.quote: Hardly the bed of the ravine below / His feet had reached, ere they had reached the hill / Right over us

inferno-23.title: THE HYPOCRITES
inferno-23.quote: They had on mantles with the hoods low down / Before their eyes

inferno-23.title: THE HYPOCRITES—CRUCIFIED PHARISEE
inferno-23.quote: "This transfixed one, whom thou seest, / Counselled the Pharisees that it was meet / To put one man to torture for the people"

inferno-24.title: THIEVES
inferno-24.quote: Among this cruel and most dismal throng / People were running naked and affrighted

inferno-25.title: TRANSFORMATION INTO SNAKES
inferno-25.quote: "O me, Agnello, how thou changest! / Behold, thou now art neither two nor one"

inferno-26.title: EVIL COUNSELLORS
inferno-26.quote: "Within the fires the spirits are; / Each swathes himself with that wherewith he burns"

inferno-28.title: SCHISMATICS—MAHOMET
inferno-28.quote: He looked at me, and opened with his hands / His bosom, saying: "See now how I rend me"

inferno-28.title: BERTRAM DE BORN
inferno-28.quote: By the hair it held the head dissevered, / Hung from the hand in fashion of a lantern, / And that upon us gazed and said: "O me!"

inferno-29.title: GERI DEL BELLO
inferno-29.quote: But said Virgilius: "What dost thou still gaze at? / Why is thy sight still riveted down there / Among the mournful, mutilated shades?"

inferno-29.title: FORGERS
inferno-29.quote: Such a stench came from it / As from putrescent limbs is wont to issue

inferno-29.title: FORGERS
inferno-29.quote: Every one was plying fast the bite / Of nails upon himself, for the great rage / Of itching which no other succour had

inferno-30.title: FORGERS
inferno-30.quote: "That mad sprite is Gianni Schicchi, / And raving goes thus harrying other people"

inferno-30.title: MYRRHA
inferno-30.quote: "That is the ancient ghost / Of the nefarious Myrrha, who became / Beyond all rightful love her father's lover"

inferno-31.title: THE GIANTS—NIMROD
inferno-31.quote: "Soul idiotic, / Keep to thy horn, and vent thyself with that, / When wrath or other passion touches thee"

inferno-31.title: EPHIALTES
inferno-31.quote: "This proud one wished to make experiment / Of his own power against the Supreme Jove"

inferno-31.title: ANTAEUS—DESCENT TO THE LAST CIRCLE
inferno-31.quote: But lightly in the abyss, which swallows up / Judas with Lucifer, he put us down

inferno-32.title: COCYTUS—TRAITORS
inferno-32.quote: "Look how thou steppest! / Take heed thou do not trample with thy feet / The heads of the tired, miserable brothers!"

inferno-32.title: TRAITORS—BOCCA DEGLI ABATI
inferno-32.quote: Then by the scalp behind I seized upon him, / And said: "It must needs be thou name thyself, / Or not a hair remain upon thee here"

inferno-32.title: UGOLINO AND ARCHBISHOP RUGGIERI
inferno-32.quote: The uppermost on the other set his teeth, / There where the brain is to the nape united

inferno-33.title: UGOLINO
inferno-33.quote: "I calmed me then, not to make them more sad"

inferno-33.title: UGOLINO AND GADDO
inferno-33.quote: "Gaddo / Threw himself down outstretched before my feet, / Saying, 'My father, why dost thou not help me?'"

inferno-33.title: UGOLINO
inferno-33.quote: "Then hunger did what sorrow could not do"

inferno-34.title: THE JUDECCA—LUCIFER
inferno-34.quote: "Behold Dis, and behold the place / Where thou with fortitude must arm thyself"

inferno-34.title: THE WAY TO THE UPPER WORLD
inferno-34.quote: The Guide and I into that hidden road / Now entered, to return to the bright world

inferno-34.title: THE POETS EMERGE FROM HELL
inferno-34.quote: Thence we came forth to rebehold the stars

purgatorio-1.title: VENUS
purgatorio-1.quote: The beauteous planet, that to love incites, / Was making all the orient to laugh, / Veiling the Fishes that were in her escort

purgatorio-1.title: CATO OF UTICA
purgatorio-1.quote: I saw beside me an old man alone, / Worthy of so much reverence in his look, / That more owes not to father any son

purgatorio-2.title: THE VESSEL
purgatorio-2.quote: But when he clearly recognized the pilot, / He cried: "Make haste, make haste to bow the knee! / Behold the Angel of God!"

purgatorio-2.title: THE CELESTIAL PILOT
purgatorio-2.quote: Beatitude seemed written in his face

purgatorio-3.title: THE MOUNTAIN'S FOOT
purgatorio-3.quote: On the left hand appeared to me a throng / Of souls, that moved their feet in our direction, / And did not seem to move

purgatorio-4.title: THE ASCENT
purgatorio-4.quote: We mounted upward through the rifted rock, / And on each side the border pressed upon us

purgatorio-4.title: THE LATE REPENTERS
purgatorio-4.quote: There were persons there / Who in the shadow stood behind the rock, / As one through indolence is wont to stand

purgatorio-5.title: THE LATE REPENTERS
purgatorio-5.quote: Meanwhile along the mountain-side across / Came people in advance of us a little, / Singing the Miserere verse by verse

purgatorio-5.title: BUONCONTE DA MONTEFELTRO
purgatorio-5.quote: "God's Angel took me up, and he of hell / Shouted: 'O thou from heaven, why dost thou rob me?'"

purgatorio-5.title: PIA
purgatorio-5.quote: "Do thou remember me who am the Pia; / Siena made me, unmade me Maremma"

purgatorio-7.title: SORDELLO AND VIRGIL
purgatorio-7.quote: So he appeared; and then bowed down his brow, / And with humility returned towards him, / And, where inferiors embrace, embraced him

purgatorio-7.title: THE DELL
purgatorio-7.quote: "Salve Regina," on the green and flowers / There seated, singing, spirits I beheld

purgatorio-8.title: THE SERPENT
purgatorio-8.quote: Hearing the air cleft by their verdant wings, / The serpent fled, and round the Angels wheeled

purgatorio-9.title: TWILIGHT
purgatorio-9.quote: The concubine of old Tithonus now / Gleamed white upon the eastern balcony

purgatorio-9.title: THE EAGLE
purgatorio-9.quote: Terrible as the lightning he descended, / And snatched me upward even to the fire

purgatorio-9.title: THE PORTALS OF PURGATORY
purgatorio-9.quote: I saw him seated on the highest stair, / Such in the face that I endured it not. / And in his hand he held a naked sword

purgatorio-10.title: THE SCULPTURES
purgatorio-10.quote: The wretched woman in the midst of these / Seemed to be saying: "Give me vengeance, Lord, / For my dead son"

purgatorio-12.title: THE PRIDEFUL—ODERISI
purgatorio-12.quote: Abreast, like oxen going in a yoke, / I with that heavy-laden soul went on

purgatorio-12.title: ARACHNE
purgatorio-12.quote: O mad Arachne! so I thee beheld / E'en then half spider

purgatorio-13.title: THE ENVIOUS
purgatorio-13.quote: Covered with sackcloth vile they seemed to me, / And one sustained the other with his shoulder, / And all of them were by the bank sustained

purgatorio-13.title: SAPIA
purgatorio-13.quote: "Sienese was I," it replied, "and with / The others here recleanse my guilty life"

purgatorio-15.title: THE STONING OF STEPHEN
purgatorio-15.quote: Then saw I people hot in fire of wrath, / With stones a young man slaying, clamorously / Still crying to each other, "Kill him! kill him!"

purgatorio-16.title: MARCO THE LOMBARD
purgatorio-16.quote: "Now who art thou, that cleavest through our smoke, / And art discoursing of us even as though / Thou didst by calends still divide the time?"

purgatorio-16.title: MARCO THE LOMBARD
purgatorio-16.quote: "Thee will I follow far as is allowed me," / He answered; "and if smoke prevent our seeing, / Hearing shall keep us joined instead thereof"

purgatorio-18.title: THE SLOTHFUL
purgatorio-18.quote: But taken from me was this drowsiness / Suddenly by a people, that behind / Our backs already had come round to us

purgatorio-19.title: ASCENT TO THE FIFTH CIRCLE
purgatorio-19.quote: "What aileth thee, that aye to earth thou gazest?" / To me my Guide began to say, we both / Somewhat beyond the Angel having mounted

purgatorio-19.title: THE AVARICIOUS—ADRIAN V
purgatorio-19.quote: "What cause," he said, "has downward bent thee thus?" / And I to him: "For your own dignity, / Standing, my conscience stung me with remorse"

purgatorio-20.title: THE AVARICIOUS
purgatorio-20.quote: Onward we went with footsteps slow and scarce, / And I attentive to the shades I heard / Piteously weeping and bemoaning them

purgatorio-23.title: THE GLUTTONS—FORESE
purgatorio-23.quote: "Ah, do not look at this dry leprosy," / Entreated he, "which doth my skin discolor, / Nor at default of flesh that I may have"

purgatorio-24.title: THE GLUTTONS
purgatorio-24.quote: And shadows, that appeared things doubly dead, / From out the sepulchres of their eyes betrayed / Wonder at me, aware that I was living

purgatorio-24.title: THE TREE
purgatorio-24.quote: People I saw beneath it lift their hands, / And cry I know not what towards the leaves

purgatorio-25.title: THE SEVENTH CIRCLE
purgatorio-25.quote: There the embankment shoots forth flames of fire, / And upward doth the cornice breathe a blast / That drives them back, and from itself sequesters

purgatorio-25.title: THE SEVENTH CIRCLE
purgatorio-25.quote: "Summae Deus clementiae," in the bosom / Of the great burning chanted then I heard, / Which made me no less eager to turn round

purgatorio-25.title: THE SEVENTH CIRCLE—THE LUSTFUL
purgatorio-25.quote: And spirits saw I walking through the flame; / Wherefore I looked, to my own steps and theirs / Apportioning my sight from time to time

purgatorio-27.title: LEAH
purgatorio-27.quote: Youthful and beautiful in dreams methought / I saw a lady walking in a meadow, / Gathering flowers

purgatorio-28.title: TERRESTRIAL PARADISE
purgatorio-28.quote: Already my slow steps had carried me / Into the ancient wood so far, that I / Could not perceive where I had entered it

purgatorio-29.title: APOCALYPTIC PROCESSION
purgatorio-29.quote: The four and twenty Elders, two by two, / Came on incoronate with flower-de-luce

purgatorio-29.title: CHARITY, HOPE AND FAITH
purgatorio-29.quote: One so very red / That in the fire she hardly had been noted. / The second was as if her flesh and bones / Had all been fashioned out of emerald; / The third appeared as snow but newly fallen

purgatorio-30.title: BEATRICE
purgatorio-30.quote: Appeared a lady under a green mantle, / Vested in color of the living flame

purgatorio-31.title: SUBMERSION IN LETHE
purgatorio-31.quote: The beautiful lady opened wide her arms, / Embraced my head, and plunged me underneath, / Where I was forced to swallow the water

purgatorio-32.title: THE WHORE AND THE GIANT
purgatorio-32.quote: Upright beside her I beheld a giant; / And ever and anon they kissed each other

purgatorio-33.title: THE EUNOË
purgatorio-33.quote: If, Reader, I possessed a longer space / For writing it, I yet would sing in part / Of the sweet draught that ne'er would satiate me

paradiso-3.title: THE MOON
paradiso-3.quote: Saw I many faces prompt to speak

paradiso-5.title: MERCURY
paradiso-5.quote: So I beheld more than a thousand splendors / Drawing towards us

paradiso-8.title: VENUS—CHARLES MARTEL
paradiso-8.quote: "That left-hand margin, which did bathe itself / In Rhone, when it is mingled with the Sorgue, / Me for its lord awaited in due time"

paradiso-12.title: THE SUN—GLORIFIED SOULS
paradiso-12.quote: In such wise of those sempiternal roses / The garlands twain encompassed us about, / And thus the outer to the inner answered

paradiso-14.title: MARS
paradiso-14.quote: Well was I ware that I was more uplifted / By the enkindled smiling of the star, / That seemed to me more ruddy than its wont

paradiso-14.title: THE CROSS
paradiso-14.quote: Here doth my memory overcome my genius; / For on that cross as levin gleamed forth Christ, / So that I cannot find ensample worthy

paradiso-16.title: CACCIAGUIDA
paradiso-16.quote: "You are my ancestor, / You give to me all hardihood to speak, / You lift me so that I am more than I"

paradiso-18.title: JUPITER
paradiso-18.quote: The holy creatures / Sang flying to and fro

paradiso-18.title: JUPITER
paradiso-18.quote: O soldiery of heaven, whom I contemplate, / Implore for those who are upon the earth / All gone astray after the bad example!

paradiso-19.title: THE EAGLE
paradiso-19.quote: Appeared before me with its wings outspread / The beautiful image that in sweet fruition / Made jubilant the interwoven souls

paradiso-20.title: THE EAGLE
paradiso-20.quote: Those living luminaries all, / By far more luminous, did songs begin / Lapsing and falling from my memory

paradiso-21.title: BEATRICE
paradiso-21.quote: Already on my Lady's face mine eyes / Again were fastened

paradiso-21.title: SATURN
paradiso-21.quote: A stairway I beheld to such height / Uplifted, that mine eye pursued it not

paradiso-26.title: THE HEAVEN OF THE FIXED STARS
paradiso-26.quote: "Begin then, and declare to what thy soul / Is aimed, and count it for a certainty, / Sight is in thee bewildered and not dead"

paradiso-27.title: THE HEAVEN OF THE FIXED STARS
paradiso-27.quote: "Glory be to the Father, to the Son, / And Holy Ghost!" all Paradise began, / So that the melody inebriate made me

paradiso-28.title: CRYSTALLINE HEAVEN
paradiso-28.quote: Not otherwise does iron scintillate / When molten, than those circles scintillated

paradiso-31.title: THE EMPYREAN
paradiso-31.quote: In fashion then as of a snow-white rose / Displayed itself to me the saintly host
